definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: Therefore, it is suggested that there is a great potential for the ore-search inYongmeihui metallogenic area.
sentences.chinese: 通过对比表明，永海会地区具有极大的找矿前应景。

sentences.english: Moreover, the film's powerful cast is entirely a product of the occasion.
sentences.chinese: 更何况影片超强的演员阵容完全是应景产物。

sentences.english: In addition to moon cake, some popular fruit Asians eat on Moon Festival are pomelo and star fruit.
sentences.chinese: 除了月饼之外亚洲人常吃的应景水果就是柚子与杨桃。

sentences.english: With the increasing heated economics soar, China fever has become more and more to the world's sight.
sentences.chinese: 随着中国经济的急速升温，中国热自然而然应景而生。

definition: timely/at the right moment/appropriate to the occasion/opportune/to fit current fashion
variant of 別緻|别致[bie2 zhi4]
to act cleverly to get what one desires/to get the best at least expense
to hit on sth new (idiom); to display originality/to adopt an original approach
to have quite a lasting charm
background (of a painting)/backdrop/a foil (to set off something to advantage)/to offset (something to advantage)
the brush stroke that dots in the eyes (idiom); fig. to add the vital finishing touch/the crucial point that brings the subject to life/a few words to clinch the point
